research.description: Adaptive fault-tolerant control for real-time systems using reinforcement learning (RL).
achievements: Developing a modular RL library with support for system design, modification, visualization, and learning in descrete and continuous spaces.
Modelling an aircraft fuel tank system as a non-stationary environment for the learning agent.
Applying variations of Q-Learning (online/offline, multi-step backup, priority sweeping) to gauge learning performance.

experience.title: Teaching Assistant
achievements: Mentor engineering design teams through their senior design projects.
Grade team reports and provide logistical assistance to instructor.
Train students in use of electrical and mechanical equipment.

experience.title: Research Intern
achievements: Performed data mining on dark matter simulation data (~3.7TB).
Visualized halo formation and evolution using simulation results.
Coded and scheduled jobs on the university's computing cluster: ACCRE.
Developed tools to generate animated snapshots of halo evolution.
Analyzed particle distributions in different halo finder protocols (AHF, Rockstar).

experience.title: Research Assistant
achievements: Designed an algorithm to fit dark matter N-body simulation data to ellipsoidal halos.
Obtain half mass radii to improve upon the Navarro–Frenk–White (NFW) profile.
Programmed a flexible multi-core processing interface to achieve data parallelism on distributed systems.
Incorporated existing code for reading simulation data into a modular and scalable Python class for use in further research.

experience.title: Team Leader
experience.workplace: Vanderbilt School of Engineering - Senior Design
achievements: Developed digital signal processing module in python using GNURadio for RTL software defined radios.
Designed a satellite tracking antenna using servo motors and 3D printed components.
Programmed a real-time trajectory visualization and motor control interface in D3.js, Python, and C via a browser, local server, and Arduino Uno board.

experience.title: Business Intelligence Intern
achievements: Wrote backwards compatible SQL query  to consolidate 40 million sales records into 1.5 million records with no data loss.
Developed and documented a python module to resolve record timing conflicts in SQL joins. Integrated with main data workflow in Alteryx.
Designed and scripted data visualizations in Domo to serve location specific content to sales managers all over continental US.
Programmed a SQL procedure to take selective backups monthly that reduced backup size by 75%.

experience.title: Student Helpdesk Assistant
achievements: Diagnosed and troubleshot computer, smartphone, and campus wide IT issues.
Recovered $3000 worth of accidentally deleted data from hard drives.
Assisted students in setting up course-specific applications on their computers.

experience.title: Research Intern
achievements: Studied sources of radiation induced errors and programmed an Altera DE2 FPGA board to test SRAM chips for soft errors after irradiation.
Wrote documentation and designed schematics for researchers at the Institute of Space and Defense Electronics.

experience.title: Instructor
experience.workplace: Android Application Development Workshop - NUST, Pakistan
achievements: Proposed and organized a week-long workshop attended by 40 professionals and graduate and undergraduate students.
Taught basic application development skills for Android using MIT AppInventor to attendees with diverse technical skillsets.
Mentored teams for final day projects and provided one-on-one guidance.

projects.title: QLearning
projects.description: A library for modeling continuous and discrete systems with faults, applying temporal difference learning algorithms for real-time control, and visualizing and benchmarking performance.

projects.title: imgurPCA v2
projects.description: Parsing comments on imgur.com for principal component analysis. Parsed comments are pre-processed for feature selection before being passed for analysis and later clustering.

projects.title: SatTrack
projects.description: A simple, easy to use library for visualizing satellite paths, predicting future passes, and tracking satellite trajectories using servo motors. Developed for Institute for Space and Defense Electronics - Software Defined Radio (ISDE-SDR) project at Vanderbilt.

extracurriculars.title: Resident Advisor
description: Oversaw administrative floor activities in Lewis Hall.
Supported 60 residents with academic and personal issues.
Collaborated with other Resident Advisors to create a friendly atmosphere for student residents.
Arranged recreational and educational activities with students.

extracurriculars.title: Mentor and Technical Specialist - Vanderbilt Design Studio
description: Maintained and repaired 3D printers, electronics, and tools at the Design Studio.
Assisted users in design process with Makerbot Desktop and Autodesk 123D Design.

extracurriculars.title: AcFee Subcommittee for Cultural Organizations
description: Reviewed campus organizations’ annual applications for funding.
Allocated $218,000 from university funds to 43 organizations based on performance analyses.

extracurriculars.title: Vanderbilt Student Volunteers for Science
description: Trained for teaching science subjects to middle school students
Taught robotics using Lego Mindstorms to 8th graders in Nashville over several sessions.
